title: The Last Lance
report:
Welcome back to another Jart Report, where we are currently mourning the loss of brother Trey Lance to a gruesome injury. The $33 man will be deeply missed, but Danny Dimes knows that it is next man up. More than anything, the Report is upset that Trey’s injury cost a chance to shut MW up for a week. But alas, let’s get underway with another report after a fun Week Two!

Week Two Recap:

Expand the IR vs Alyssa Robinson:

Prediction: Expand the IR by 14.5

Reality: Expand the IR by 41.12

“Good game” - Bank

“MB won the battle but I’ll win the war.” - Brad

Team ACL Tear vs Team Nooni:

Prediction: Team Nooni by 27.3

Reality: Team Nooni by 20.92

“Embarrassing performance by my team. Congrats to Nooni” - JL

“Happy for the W, but 8th place roto finish is disappointing. Always a double edged sword when your bench absolutely goes off. Glad to see my guys perform, just need some better roster decisions moving forward for roto” - Nooni

Team Michaels vs Two Cooks in the Kitchen:

Prediction: Two Cooks in the Kitchen by 4.3

Reality: Two Cooks in the Kitchen by 21.76

Don’t bother me, I’m busy - Dmichs

Don’t bother me, I’m busy - Aross

Team Immunized vs Team Levine:

Prediction: Team Immunized by 7.8

Reality: Team Immunized by 16.98

“Excited that I finally got in the win column. Shoutout to all my boys. I put them in a position to succeed and they pulled through. Levine it was a pleasure, nothing better than a sweat going into MNF. I wish you the best of luck the rest of the year besides week 13” - Jason

“People counted team Levine out. We are a team of Tua and underdogs. Only if Jefferson was decent or I started Cooper and I would be top 3. Feel better than I did last week” - Levine

Step Burrow I’m Stuck vs Team Horses:

Prediction: Step Burrow I’m Stuck by 3.3

Reality: Step Burrow I’m Stuck by 9.64

“I went trial back-to-back binch I’m 2-0!” - NN

“Good job Noah :)” - Folbe

United Nations vs The Report:

Prediction: United Nations by 7.5

Reality: United Nations by 8.74

“Always a pleasure winning against your team” - MW

“A good measuring stick game. Team did a lot of really good things, the injury to Lance obviously derailed what would have been a nice win. But confidence is high moving forward” - Jart

The Him Larrañaga Award For Excellence

We’re keeping in the hometown this week as the award goes to Amon-Ra St. Brown. The things he is doing are absurd, and also keeping Alex afloat amidst disappointing RB play and very mediocre QBs. A 116 yard day and 2 TDs is becoming more the expected than the exception for this young gun who knows every WR drafted before him, and as long as Goff keeps slinging it and proving that Sean McVay is a bust, the Lions will keep on putting up points. What a botch by MW to not have this excellent Lion on his squad. Congratulations to Amon-Ra on being Him Larrañaga this week!

Who’s Back Of The Week?

Team:Nooni! Buddy you won! I’m so proud of you. The QB situation is obviously very concerning here, but Kelce is a cheat code, and the RBs and Jaylen Waddle look great long term.

Honorable Mention: Bank. 1st in PF (stupid Hurts INT) this week, this team is going to go as far as the Bills do. While Diggs’ numbers should reduce with Gabe Davis back in action, there’s a lot to like with Herbert and Allen.

Player:Nick Chubb. Happy to toot my own horn here, as Chubb is currently RB1 with a 3 TD performance, and while Hunt will continue to linger, he certainly has bellcow status heading into a Thursday night matchup with the Steelers.

Honorable Mention: Tyreek Hill. New city? No problem. Scoring 30 fantasy points in 7 minutes of game time is absurd.

Something Else:The Miami Dolphins. My QB board going into the draft was Hurts, Kyler, Tua, Lance. In that order. Don’t ask me why I took Lance. Levine can attest to how hard I tried to trade for Tua before the season began.

Honorable Mention: The Detroit Lions. Despite NN’s best efforts, there’s no stopping this squad from going forward down the field. One pride baby.

Who’s Not Back Of The Week?

Team:Folbe. A full on fire sale might not be required yet, but Matt Ryan is looking atrocious, the RB room is questionable at best, and the WRs are not yet producing at the level one would hope. Things could certainly turn around, but through two weeks the outlook is bleak.

Honorable Mention: JL. The 1-1 record is a nice facade for a team that has only scored 0.6 points more than Folbe.

Player:Trey Lance. After struggling week one, Trey’s season is officially over. Thanks for the 12 points buddy.

Honorable Mention: Alvin Kamara. We’ll see if he can get back on the field and produce, but let me tell you this, this writer does not value him higher than current RB1 Nick Chubb.

Something Else: “Him”. The NFL killed it. But we retain the Jart Report segment.

Honorable Mention: Top RBs. With no RB scoring at least 17 points in each of the first two weeks, there has not been much consistency at the position where a lot of money was spent in our auction.

Transaction Analysis:

Best Transaction: Curtis Samuel, $14. We’ll see how long this lasts with the competition in that WR room, but a shrewd bid by Bank has gotten him a very nice FLEX option.

Honorable Mention: Treylon Burks, $0. He seems to be the clear-cut WR1 in Tennessee, whose role should hopefully grow as he gets acclimated and fills AJB’s shoes. QB play is going to be a major issue though.

Worst Transaction: Rex Burkhead, $26. A RB who got no carries. Zero. Oof. GBR though.

Honorable Mention: Geno Smith, $22. Maybe this one will prove to be alright. But MW could have got him for $1, and Geno looked pretty below average this week.

Record by PF Finish:

1st: 2-0

2nd: 2-0

3rd: 2-0

4th: 0-2

5th: 1-1

6th: 0-2

7th: 1-1

8th: 1-1

9th: 2-0

10th: 0-2

11th: 1-1

12th: 0-2

Worst Possible Lineup:

QB: Jameis Winston, 7.64 points, Nooni

RB: Rex Burkhead, 1.9 points, Brad

RB: Cordarelle Patterson, 4.1 points, Dmichs

WR: DJ Chark, 0 points, Levine

WR: Darnell Mooney, 0.1 points, Brad (congrats to Darnell on back to back weeks)

TE: Dalton Schultz, 1.8 points, Aross

FLEX: Rashaad Penny, 1.5 points, Levine

SUPERFLEX: Ryan Tannehill, 0.88 points, Nooni

D/ST: Indy D/ST, 0 points, JL

Total Points: 17.92

Would it have beaten Folbe: No sir, but maybe in a couple weeks

Best Possible Lineup:

QB: Tua Tagovailoa, 38.86 points, Levine

RB: Nick Chubb, 30.8 points, Jart

RB: Aaron Jones, 30.5 points, Jase

WR: Stefon Diggs, 38.8 points, Bank

WR: Jaylen Waddle, 34.6 points, Nooni

TE: Mark Andrews, 25.7 points, Levine

FLEX: Tyreek Hill, 36.5 points, MW

SUPERFLEX: Lamar Jackson, 42.62 points, Brad

D/ST: Bucs D/ST, 24.0 points, Dmichs

Total Points: 302.38

Would it have beaten Dwitt in 2019: Yeesh, this OP is OP!

Best Benchwarmer Lineup:

QB: Carson Wentz, 27.78 points, NN (once again!)

RB: Tony Pollard, 17.8 points, Nooni

RB: Damien Harris, 15.7 points, Nooni

WR: Garrett Wilson, 26.0 points, Jase

WR: Christian Kirk, 22.8 points, Jart (once again!)

TE: Hunter Henry, 0.0 points, Dmichs

FLEX: Drake London, 20.6 points, Folbe

SUPERFLEX: Amari Cooper, 20.6 points, Levine

D/ST: Pittsburgh D/ST, 2.0 points, Dmichs

Total Points: 153.28

How many teams would it have beaten this week: All 12

The Trade Jartalyzer:

Trade #1:

Brad: George Kittle, Ceedee Lamb, Matt Ryan (Grade: B-)

Folbe: Lamar Jackson, Isiah Pacheco (Grade: A-)

We begin to see the effect of the Superflex. Lamar looks electric, and it enters Folbe into the stack squad with Bateman. For Brad, the dynamic QB duo is lost, and instead a risky 2-TE set has been formed. If Kittle can stay healthy and Matt Ryan can be average, this has potential. But as of right now, Folbe has gotten a more sure thing and improved his standing.

Trade #2:

Jason: Davis Mills (Grade: B+)

Brad: George Pickens (Grade: C-)

George Pickens will be a baller one day. But today is not yet that day. Davis Mills is more valuable, having just thrown 38 passes last game.

You Don’t Know Ball Ranks:

This segment submitted by long-time fan Merrick Bank will simply be a ranking of how well each person in this league knows ball. As always, this will be based solely on logic and facts.

  1. Alex
  2. Jart
  3. Jason
  4. NN
  5. Folbe
  6. JL
  7. Levine
  8. Dmichs
  9. Bank
  10. MW
  11. Brad
  12. Nooni (I’m still not convinced you watch the NFL)

Roses and Thorns

Submitted by Noah Nathan, this segment gives me a chance to share the best and worst thing from this week in my own life. “Everyone always asks ‘when’s the jart report’ but nobody ever asks ‘how is the Jart behind the report’”.

Rose: Friday night I had a bonfire with a couple of my best friends out here in Lincoln, and then Saturday I tailgated with a couple of them before the Nebraska game and then went to the Nebraska Wesleyan football game after. Just a lot of good times with friends!

Thorn: I have to read a book and write a book report on it for seminary this week along with all of my normal tasks. Just got a lot to do, and it is going to take up pretty much all of my remaining free time this week! My professor is also a very tough grader, so I need to do a very good job on this assignment. I have very bad senioritis as this is my last semester, but we gotta buckle down and knock it out! It has been a good week overall though :)

Jart’s Mailbag:

Who is Nebraska hiring?

The top three candidates released today are Leipold, Campbell, and BOB. I’m guessing Matt Rhule is also a top candidate, but he of course needs to be fired by the Panthers first. Campbell seems like the safest pick, but I personally hope that it is Rhule.

Rank the league in order of how many beers they could drink without having to pee?

  1. Folbe
  2. Jason
  3. NN
  4. Levine
  5. Jart
  6. Dmichs
  7. Aross
  8. Nooni
  9. JL
  10. Bank
  11. Brad
  12. MW

Will Jason be able to surpass his longest win streak of 2 games (per bloomfieldfantasyreference.com)?

Yes! That is a team that I really love from top to bottom, and if the win streak is snapped it will be because his opponent went off rather than a poor showing on his end. Dare I say the win streak will be 5+ at some point this season? I do dare say so.

Please rank the Nebraska job in CFB?

After establishing that it is T-3 in the Big Ten this week, I think we need to look at the reality that there are only a few conferences offering top jobs at this point as realignment occurs. In the ACC, only Clemson would be ahead at this point, although even that is beginning to fade. The future SEC offers Alabama, Georgia, Texas, Oklahoma, and LSU ahead of Nebraska. In considering the Pac-12, I would only put USC above Nebraska, although Oregon may be close. So all in all, I would say it is tied for the 11th best job in the country!

Who will have the cutest babies?

Cutest? For sure MW. He’s so fricken cute. And Amanda should make a great mother. I’m not sure if JL could answer this question though, as I don’t think he’s looked at Amanda’s face before.

Will Marcus Mariota outscore Trey Lance this season?

Touche. A little rude considering Lance just broke himself, but yes, Mariota will. But probably not by a ton #RidderSznSoon.

Is this the Bills team that finally breaks through?

Through two weeks, I would be hard pressed to pick any other team. In general I would take the field over a specific team, especially because a Josh Allen injury would derail the season very quickly (he really does need to learn to slide). If I had to pick a team right now though, it would be the Bills with zero hesitation. I just hope their defense can continue to average 17 PPG.

How does it feel to be 0-2? Can’t relate.

Not too bad. In a pre-roto era it would be very tough, since I have been Top 6 in PF both weeks. But ultimately, the wins and losses only matter for getting a top 4 seed. And our goal is just to make the playoffs, and let whatever happen from there. Right now the main concern is building a great roster from top to bottom, and while the Lance injury presents a big concern, we are feeling very good about every other spot!

Who is the Jalen Hurts of the NBA?

If this question is who is my favorite player in the NBA, then the answer is Damian Lillard. However, it seems to be more from a budding star talent level. It may be too early to give Hurts this level of praise, but I would say Luka. A young guy who is developing into an absolute stud before our eyes, and that Hurts celebration on the dot to Quez Watkins gave me chills.

Would you rather have Lamar or Kittle?

Would I rather have an elite QB in a Superflex league or a TE who can never stay healthy and has Jimmy G at Quarterback? Hmm. Definitely Lamar. I think Lamar puts Folbe right into contention in a way that he simply was not before, and the WR and TE positions are deep enough that ultimately Folbe will get similar production from those spots. Big win for him.

Who has your favorite roster in UNIT? Least favorite?

Favorite: Jason (shocker, I know). I don’t see that team scoring under 100 this season, and sometimes, consistency is king. This week showed that they can go to the 150 mark too.

Least Favorite: Brad. There’s just nothing that jumps out at you as elite. RBs are bad, WRs are mid, and the TE could be good but has a lot to prove.

Are you interested in acquiring a QB or is Danny Dimes your guy?

Yes to both. I am not actively pursuing a trade for a QB currently, but as guys slide into my DMs I am entering into conversations about their QBs to gauge where people are at. Thought I made a pretty fair counter tonight, but sometimes you just don’t see fully eye-to-eye! I do like Danny Dimes’ upside in a Brian Daboll offense, and don’t forget that he is faster than Lamar. Getting Saquon loose in the passing game could prove lethal, although it would be nice to see Kenny Golladay not be trash.

Who wins the NFC North?

I really want to pick the Lions. But it is not our time yet. Really can’t pick anyone besides the Packers at this point, even after the Vikings beat them in Week One. Lazard gives the Packers more stability at WR, and it is not yet time to feel okay about picking against Rodgers.

If you had to pick a league winner today, who would it be?

Jason. I think a high fantasy floor is huge given the volatility of fantasy football. You need to have 2-3 solid weeks to win the championship, and his team is the one that I currently feel best about. But we also know that for all teams, but especially a Jason managed team, injuries are likely on the horizon and will shake things up in a major way.

Why is fantasy so dumb?

Because head coaches don’t care about fantasy football, as we learned from the Falcons and Kyle Pitts this week. And so we’re just at the mercy of game flow and what coaches want to do that week. And then players get hurt, and you have to try your best to rise above the rest in the crapshoot. It is overall a great time!

Will CJ ever try to make a run to join the league again? Will we accept him?

Nah, I think he really is done this time. But if he did, I do not think the league would accept him. He played with too many hearts for too long!

How tf is Brian Robinson practicing? This guy got shot in his legs

Nick Saban’s deal with the devil extends to all of his former players as well. And frankly Antonio Gibson does not deserve a starting role, so I am hopeful that Robinson can get back to playing soon. He is a very easy guy to root for moving forward!

You have one league member to make a free throw, a putt, and a 25 yard field goal to save your life, who do you choose and why (One person for all three)?

I will take Aross, although Folbe was a close second. Those just all seem like things that Alex can do with little to no issue. At the same time, I think Folbe might be more concerned about saving my life. So maybe I will take Folbe.

What is a reasonable bid for Jimmy G?

One dollar more than what someone else bids for him! As someone who has placed a $1 bid for Jimmy G, I feel I can speak openly on this one. I would say anything under $30 is reasonable. You are hoping to get a solid QB2 here, and that can fill a big gap for some team. FAAB does have value, but its value is to help fill gaps, and this is a clear opportunity to do so.

Who does the report think the worst team in the NFL is at the moment?

In a close one between the Titans and Panthers, we will lean towards the Titans. The defense looks lost, Tannehill looks terrible, without AJB around teams can key in on Henry more. There is hope, and the development of Burks could be huge for the offense, but they have a lot to prove. The Panthers are pretty bad though, they should definitely fire Matt Rhule and they should fire him as soon as possible so he can move on with his life and be at a place where he belongs and can win many games and be what Scott Frost could not be.

Mailbag Question of the Week:

How long until all league members are back living in MI?

This question wins primarily because multiple of you asked me it and that was funny. I think we will see the whole league return by 2028, so around the time everyone is 30. I plan on being back by July 2023, and once we start rolling out the live, in-person auction drafts, people will be flooding back to the great state of Michigan. Especially with the Lions looking better, Ashton getting the Pistons right, and all of us getting jobs at SANA. I will guess that JL is the final one.

Mailbag Question Asking Standings:

  1. Jason (26)
  2. Bank (17)
  3. Brad (15)
  4. NN (12)
  5. MW (12)
  6. Folbe (8)
  7. JL (6)
  8. Nooni (4)
  9. Levine (3)
  10. Dmichs (2)
  11. Aross (1)

League Takes:

Agree:

-MWs WR strategy is paying off

-Team Ross is clearly anti team Levine -anon

-MB makes the playoffs somehow

-Brad gonna make a really dumb trade soon that works out for him

Neutral:

-MW misses playoffs

-Levine will get hot

Disagree:

-Jarrett starts 0-3 and then makes playoffs

-Merrick vs Merrick final

-Scott frost will soon be an assistant at bama for nick saban

-There will be a 5 time league Champion after this year

Jart’s Power Rankings:

  1. MW (+2)
  2. Jason (+4)
  3. Bank (+4)
  4. Levine (+1)
  5. NN (-4)
  6. Jart (-2)
  7. Nooni (+5)
  8. Dmichs (-6)
  9. Folbe (+2)
  10. Brad (-1)
  11. Alex (-3)
  12. JL (-2)

Week Three:

Expand the IRvs Team Levine: Both of these teams are coming off electric weeks from their QBs, with Bank’s looking like the safer bet to replicate such high level performances. Both Tua and Goff look very promising though, so there could be a lot of fireworks from the signal callers once again in this matchup. RB is a bit of a scary spot for both of these teams currently, but the bellcow status of Najee gives Levine a slight edge. At WR, we love JJeffs to bounce back in a major way after a very disjointed MNF from the Vikings. TE could be a lot of fun this week, and we actually like Knox slightly more. Overall, this should be a fun, high-scoring affair, but we like Expand the IR by 2.7.

Bank: “Idk who I play but they’ll win”

Levine: No comment

Team Michaels vs. Team ACL Tear: While the previous matchup brings a lot of fun QB play, these four QBs disgust me. Brady is washed, Kirk sucks, Trubisky should not be playing, and Stafford can’t complete a pass to his own team. Kirk playing at noon gives the advantage to Dmichs here though. At RB, Taylor should have an absolutely monster day, giving Dmichs the clear edge as Kamara looks to establish himself this season. WR brings some fun with Adams and Chase (shout out the 2021 Family), but we trust Adams much more here due to more consistent QB play to this point and an awful Titans defense. Logan Thomas should continue to bring solid production, and overall we like Team Michaels by 13.4 .

Dmichs: No comment at this time

JL: “Everything depends on Kamara and Keenan coming back. With MEvans unjustly suspended, my boys need to get back on the field so we can clap beat Dmikes below average roster!”

Step Burrow I’m Stuck vs Hollywood’s Brown: Nooni is back boys. QB in this one is pretty gross too, but Russ and Burrow should both have somewhat bounceback performances after very shaky starts to the season. At RB, we trust Nooni’s duo to come through in a major way, although all 4 are start and forget guys. WR and TE go to Nooni in a major way, and thus we like Nooni by 1.4 in what should be a close one.

NN: “Good luck nooners! Looking forward to our battle”

Nooni: “Not sure who I’m playing, don’t care til after tomorrow at noon. Til then Hollywood’s Brown is focused on putting out the best team possible on our side of the ball”

Team Immunized vs Two Cooks in the Kitchen: Jalen Hurts will outscore Baker and Fields combined. However, if McCaffrey and Cook can get going that may be nullified. Amon-Ra in the FLEX for Aross is nasty, and he should be poised for another big day against a Vikings defense that looked soft on MNF. Where Aross goes at TE to replace Schultz should be an interesting development, but we love the floors for all of Jason’s team across the board, and the Hurts-AJB stack should continue to deliver. We like Team Immunized by 5.6.

Jase: “Wasn't sure how I felt about Alex's team after the draft. I’m still a little unsure. But I know he has the firepower to do some real damage. Gotta stay sharp this week to beat one of the league's best owners”

Aross: No comment at this time

Team Horses vs United Nations:The worst team in the league so far against the best, things could be in for a major shakeup after Folbe acquired Lamar Jackson for pennies. QB play goes Folbe’s direction in a major way in this one, while Derrick Henry should finally get on track against a weak Raiders rush defense. The Report remains skeptical of Miles Sanders, while Swift and Javonte make for a solid duo for MW. WR is of course in MW’s favor, but I expect Tyreek to be somewhat limited by a great Bills defense. This one is going to be quite interesting, but the Lamar acquisition may be just what Folbe’s team needed, and we like them to ride that spark. If they go zero dark 30 mode, it’s over. We like Team Horses by 0.1.

Folbe: “*Insert picture of lebron james zero dark 30 mode*”

MW: “There’s no one I have more respect for in the league than folbe. While the score might be close, I’m glad we get to play each other”

Alyssa Robinson vs The Report: Two teams that both just lost a QB without getting anything in return, the Superflex spot looks much more bleak for these two teams than a week ago. QB is a wash for now as Ryan and Danny Dimes remain too unpredictable, while RB goes to Jart right now with Chubb and CEH both scoring as Top-5 backs through two weeks. WR should be interesting, and overall is best viewed as a push for now. While the 2-TE stack is interesting, teams that run it are so far 0-3 this year. For this reason, we like The Report by 103.4.

Brad: “Looking forward to my bye week against the report. He’ll start the wrong guys and I’ll get a low scoring win.”

Jart: “Injuries help me set my lineup better. Thanks Trey. Time to get a win.”

Jart’s Survivor Pool:

Week Two: Nooni (Won 102.12 - 81.2)

This week, we are taking Jart. Team needs a win badly, and there’s no more messing around. This one is for Trey Lance.

Biggest Boom/Bust of the Week

This new segment submitted by Jason Silverstone, The Report’s favorite fan, will be where we predict the most volatile player scoring wise this week.

For this week, the winner is Jaylen Waddle. Fresh off of a huge week where he and Tyreek Hill both put up video game numbers, Miami faces Buffalo in what could be a very high scoring affair. However, Buffalo has been elite on defense so far this season, and Tyreek may grab a larger target share with Gesicki in the mix as well.

Best Player at Each Position:

QB: Josh Allen, Bank

RB: Jonathan Taylor, Dmichs

WR: Davante Adams, Dmichs

TE: Dawson Knox, Bank

D/ST: Falcons D/ST, FA

JL’s Power Rankings:

1. MW (+4)

2. Bank (+4)

3. Jason (+5)

4. NN (-3)

5. Levine (+5)

6. Nooni (-3)

7. Dmikes (-5)

Family Award:

Nothing says family like an elite QB-WR stack. Which makes this award difficult, as our top two scorers from this week both feature some high level stacks. However, there can only be one, and for his double stack of Rodgers-Jones and Hurts-AJB, the family award goes to Jason.
